title: Camera Hardware Electrical Engineer
summary: Do you love taking on big challenges that require exceptionally creative solutions? Do you deeply understand how an incredible camera experience should work? As part of our Camera Technologies group, you’ll help design the innovative technology that allows each generation of Apple products to produce photos even more incredible than the last.
description:
-  Work multi-functionally to develop hardware/system architectures for novel camera systems
-  Lead architecture and implementation for camera sub-system with challenging component and system requirements.
-  Develop and lead module level architecture and specifications through implementation phase including component selection, design, supervising layout and simulation, validation and system integration.
-  Lead and direct X-functional teams to resolve critical signal and power integrity, De-sense and CoEX issues
-  Author clear and comprehensive electrical test documentation for manufacturing partners 
-  Work with test teams to develop new test equipment and procedures for camera module validation and production test. 
-  Develop electronic prototypes for new camera features and product concepts
key_qualifications:
Experience in system level design and architecture
Multi-disciplinary understanding of EE, CE and Physics principles
Experience working with dynamic multi-functional teams
Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal skills focused on leadership, teamwork and collaboration. Experience in several of the following areas:
Prior experience prototyping new technologies, conducting design of experiments, and analytical data processing.
Hands-on experience in electronic design, to include component selection, schematic design,with tools like Cadence Allegro and OrCAD
...
education_experience: BS and a minimum of 10 years relevant industry experience
additional_requirements:
Occasional travel may be required, but is not a critical component of this position.
Experience with camera technology covering sensing, control and signal processing
Experience in system designs with Application processors and/or FPGA’s
Familiarity with micro-controller and instrument programming
Familiar with image quality evaluation methodology and general optical metrology
Command line interface and scripting is a plus (Matlab, Python)
Statistical data analysis and visualization (ex. JMP) is a plus
High-volume consumer electronics system experience is preferred
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role.
